result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:43 PM - case called.  Defendant Todd C. Lillie in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Todd C. Lillie.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights. 
Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Court quashes warrant.  Court questions Defendant regarding missed court.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court reinstates bond.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Body or $500.00

Defendant fails to appear.  State as complied with victim rights.  State requests a warrant.  Court questions Atty Laufenberg.  Response by Atty Laufenberg.  Court notes no victim appeared.  Court issues a warrant - body or $500.00 - Statewide.

1:32 PM - case called.  Defendant Todd C. Lillie appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.
